citeinfo.origin: University of Wisconsin - Madison - Environmental Remote Sensing Center
University of Wisconsin - Madison - Space Science and Engineering Center
citeinfo.title: Great Lakes landsat footprints wrs2

descript.abstract: Satellites such as Landsat 4, 5, and 7, Terra, EO-1 and others all share the same basic 705km, 98.9 minute near-polar sun synchronous orbit. For the Landsat series, the ground trace of the orbit is described by the WRS-2 grid or index, (also known as WRS-II, World Reference System Two). It consists of 233 unique orbit ground traces that are interlaced in 15 daily patterns of 16 orbits. Therefore, every 16 days the ground traces repeat over the same locations (good for measuring change over time). Data products from the Landsat series are produced from the strip of data received along a given path by cutting or dividing the data into rectangles or "granules" designated by row numbers for each path. There are 248 rows to accompany each path. This data layer represents the area coverage of WRS-2 polygons or Landsat "footprints" over the Great Lakes and connecting waterways. Each rectangle is approximately 185km wide and 175km long Note: Landsat 1-3 produced data tied to the WRS-1 system, which is similar but different. Information compiled by Dr. Sam Batzli, University of Wisconsin-Madison and WisconsinView.org
descript.purpose: Landsat series products can be ordered by WRS-2 Path/Row. Time series comparisons are simplified through use of this system. Even browse products can be visually interpreted for changes over time. Try http://www.americaview.org to find free downloads for your state, or http://glcfapp.umiacs.umd.edu:8080/esdi/index.jsp for free downloads, or http://www.landsat.org for low- or full-cost global imagery, and http://glovis.usgs.gov to purchase or download free imagery globally. Information compiled by Dr. Sam Batzli, University of Wisconsin-Madison and WisconsinView.org
descript.supplinf: Summary: Shapefile polygon layer showing approximate extent of Landsat 4-7 area coverage by World Reference System-2 path and row numbers. Coverage includes the Great Lakes and connecting waterways descending orbit (daylight) tiles only.

idinfo.useconst: There are not restrictions for non-commercial use of this data set.

browse.browsed: WMS-based PNG preview of dataset at full extent
